messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] To war or not to war
messages.msgSnippet: ... I love these sales. Mine once had a big sale in the front yard with tree limbs we had cut down. The sign said firwud fur sal It was kinda funny as we
messages.messageBody:
> Off to buy things from Zak (with my own money, and things that are actually
> He's having an indoor yard sale.
>
> Dawn F

I love these sales. Mine once had a big sale in the front yard with tree
limbs we had cut down. The sign said "firwud fur sal" It was kinda funny as
we lived in Hawaii and no one had any need for firewood:) But dh went out
and bought some (and he'd been the one who'd cut them down and dragged them
to the curb).

Kate

messages.subject: To war or not to war
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kate: I couldn t remember the topic so I thought I d put the above up there (sorry too lazy to go back to my e-mail)...  I m not actually going to talk
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kate:

I couldn't remember the topic so I thought I'd put the above up there (sorry
too lazy to go back to my e-mail)... I'm not actually going to talk about
that, just wanted to thank Kate for her story. I was imagining you and she
standing next to each other.

I keep thinking that if women ran the world would I, as a mother, send my
child to kill one of your children? I don't know what the answer to that
is, but I'll keep thinking about it.

Off to buy things from Zak (with my own money, and things that are actually
mine) He's having an indoor yard sale.

Dawn F
Tucson AZ
